009package com.weather.sdk.config;
010
011import java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit;
012
013/**
014 * Enumeration representing the operating modes for the Weather SDK.
015 *
016 * <p>This enum defines the two available modes for weather data retrieval: on-demand (manual) and
017 * polling (automatic). Each mode has different characteristics and is suited for different use
018 * cases.
019 *
020 * <h2>Mode Characteristics</h2>
021 *
022 * <ul>
023 *   <li><strong>ON_DEMAND:</strong> Fetches weather data when explicitly requested
024 *   <li><strong>POLLING:</strong> Automatically fetches weather data at regular intervals
025 * </ul>
026 *
027 * <h2>Usage Examples</h2>
028 *
029 * <h3>On-Demand Mode</h3>
030 *
031 * <pre>
032 * // Create SDK in on-demand mode
033 * SDKConfiguration config = new WeatherSDKBuilder()
034 *     .apiKey("your-api-key")
035 *     .mode(SDKMode.ON_DEMAND) // Manual data fetching
036 *     .build();
037 *
038 * try (WeatherSDK sdk = new DefaultWeatherSDK(config)) {
039 *
040 * // Fetch weather data only when needed
041 * WeatherData weather = sdk.getWeather("London"); // Makes API call
042 * WeatherData cached = sdk.getWeather("London"); // Uses cache if fresh
043 * </pre>
044 *
045 * <h3>Polling Mode</h3>
046 *
047 * <pre>
048 * // Create SDK in polling mode with 5-minute intervals
049 * SDKConfiguration config = new WeatherSDKBuilder()
050 *     .apiKey("your-api-key")
051 *     .mode(SDKMode.POLLING) // Automatic data fetching
052 *     .pollingInterval(Duration.ofMinutes(5))
053 *     .build();
054 *
055 * try (WeatherSDK sdk = new DefaultWeatherSDK(config)) {
056 *
057 * // Weather data is automatically updated in background
058 * WeatherData weather = sdk.getWeather("Paris"); // Uses latest polled data
059 * // Background thread fetches data every 5 minutes
060 * </pre>
061 *
062 * <h2>Mode Selection Guide</h2>
063 *
064 * <h3>Use ON_DEMAND when:</h3>
065 *
066 * <ul>
067 *   <li>Weather data is needed infrequently (sporadic usage)
068 *   <li>Resource usage should be minimized
069 *   <li>Explicit control over API calls is required
070 *   <li>User interactions drive the data retrieval
071 *   <li>Lower API costs are preferred
072 * </ul>
073 *
074 * <h3>Use POLLING when:</h3>
075 *
076 * <ul>
077 *   <li>Real-time weather updates are critical
078 *   <li>Applications display continuously updated weather information
079 *   <li>Background data refresh is acceptable
080 *   <li>Response time is more important than API costs
081 *   <li>Weather data is displayed continuously (dashboards, widgets)
082 * </ul>
083 *
084 * <h2>Default Configuration</h2>
085 *
086 * <ul>
087 *   <li><strong>Default Mode:</strong> ON_DEMAND
088 *   <li><strong>Default Polling Interval:</strong> 5 minutes (when POLLING mode is used)
089 *   <li><strong>Polling Interval Range:</strong> 1 minute to 24 hours
090 * </ul>
091 *
092 * <h2>Performance Considerations</h2>
093 *
094 * <h3>On-Demand Mode:</h3>
095 *
096 * <ul>
097 *   <li>API calls made only when explicitly requested
098 *   <li>Lower network and API usage
099 *   <li>Potential cache misses result in API calls
100 *   <li>Suitable for memory-constrained environments
101 * </ul>
102 *
103 * <h3>Polling Mode:</h3>
104 *
105 * <ul>
106 *   <li>Regular background API calls regardless of usage
107 *   <li>Higher network and API usage
108 *   <li>Consistent cache freshness
109 *   <li>Background thread overhead
110 *   <li>Better user experience with immediate data availability
111 * </ul>
112 *
113 * @since 1.0.0
114 * @see com.weather.sdk.WeatherSDK
115 * @see com.weather.sdk.config.WeatherSDKBuilder
116 * @see com.weather.sdk.config.SDKConfiguration
117 */
118public enum SDKMode {
119
120  /**
121   * On-demand mode for manual weather data fetching.
122   *
123   * <p>In this mode, the SDK only makes API calls to OpenWeatherAPI when explicitly requested
124   * through {@code getWeather()}. This is the default mode and is ideal for applications that need
125   * weather data sporadically or in response to user interactions.
126   *
127   * <p><strong>Characteristics:</strong>
128   *
129   * <ul>
130   *   <li>API calls made only when needed
131   *   <li>Lower resource usage
132   *   <li>Potential cache misses on first requests
133   *   <li>Manual control over data fetching
134   *   <li>Lower API costs
135   * </ul>
136   *
137   * <p><strong>Use Cases:</strong>
138   *
139   * <ul>
140   *   <li>Weather apps with infrequent usage
141   *   <li>Batch processing of weather data
142   *   <li>Manual weather lookups
143   *   <li>Resource-constrained environments
144   *   <li>Cost-sensitive applications
145   * </ul>
146   */
147  ON_DEMAND("on-demand", "Manual weather data fetching on request"),
148
149  /**
150   * Polling mode for automatic weather data fetching.
151   *
152   * <p>In this mode, the SDK automatically fetches weather data at regular intervals in the
153   * background, regardless of user requests. This ensures that weather data is always fresh and
154   * readily available when requested.
155   *
156   * <p><strong>Characteristics:</strong>
157   *
158   * <ul>
159   *   <li>Background API calls at regular intervals
160   *   <li>Higher resource usage
161   *   <li>Consistent cache freshness
162   *   <li>Automatic data updates
163   *   <li>Background thread management
164   * </ul>
165   *
166   * <p><strong>Use Cases:</strong>
167   *
168   * <ul>
169   *   <li>Weather dashboards and widgets
170   *   <li>Real-time weather monitoring
171   *   <li>Continuous weather displays
172   *   <li>Time-sensitive applications
173   *   <li>Applications where response time is critical
174   * </ul>
175   */
176  POLLING("polling", "Automatic weather data fetching at regular intervals");
177
178  /** The human-readable display name for this mode. */
179  private final String displayName;
180
181  /** The description of this mode. */
182  private final String description;
183
184  /**
185   * Constructs a new SDKMode with the specified display name and description.
186   *
187   * @param displayName the human-readable name for this mode. Must not be null.
188   * @param description a brief description of this mode. Must not be null.
189   * @throws NullPointerException if either parameter is null
190   */
191  SDKMode(final String displayName, final String description) {
192    this.displayName = displayName;
193    this.description = description;
194  }
195
196  /**
197   * Returns the human-readable display name for this mode.
198   *
199   * @return the display name (e.g., "on-demand", "polling"). Never returns null.
200   */
201  public String getDisplayName() {
202    return displayName;
203  }
204
205  /**
206   * Returns the description of this mode.
207   *
208   * @return the mode description. Never returns null.
209   */
210  public String getDescription() {
211    return description;
212  }
213
214  /**
215   * Indicates whether this mode requires background thread management.
216   *
217   * @return true if the mode requires background threads (polling), false otherwise
218   */
219  public boolean requiresBackgroundThreads() {
220    return this == POLLING;
221  }
222
223  /**
224   * Indicates whether this mode makes automatic API calls.
225   *
226   * @return true if the mode makes automatic API calls (polling), false otherwise
227   */
228  public boolean isAutomatic() {
229    return this == POLLING;
230  }
231
232  /**
233   * Returns the recommended default polling interval for this mode.
234   *
235   * <p>For ON_DEMAND mode, this returns a zero duration indicating no polling. For POLLING mode,
236   * this returns the recommended 5-minute interval.
237   *
238   * @return the recommended polling interval as a duration
239   */
240  public java.time.Duration getRecommendedPollingInterval() {
241    final java.time.Duration result;
242    if (this == POLLING) {
243      result = java.time.Duration.ofMinutes(5);
244    } else {
245      result = java.time.Duration.ZERO;
246    }
247    return result;
248  }
249
250  /**
251   * Validates that a polling interval is appropriate for this mode.
252   *
253   * @param interval the polling interval to validate. May be null for ON_DEMAND.
254   * @return true if the interval is valid for this mode
255   * @throws IllegalArgumentException if the interval is invalid for this mode
256   */
257  public boolean validatePollingInterval(final java.time.Duration interval) {
258    final boolean result;
259    if (this == ON_DEMAND) {
260      result = interval == null || interval.isZero() || interval.isNegative();
261    } else { // POLLING
262      if (interval == null || interval.isZero() || interval.isNegative()) {
263        result = false;
264      } else {
265        // Validate range: 1 minute to 24 hours
266        final long minutes = interval.toMinutes();
267        result = minutes >= 1 && minutes <= (24 * 60);
268      }
269    }
270    return result;
271  }
272
273  /**
274   * Gets a suggested polling interval in the specified time unit.
275   *
276   * @param timeUnit the time unit for the result
277   * @return the polling interval in the specified unit
278   * @throws UnsupportedOperationException if this mode doesn't support polling
279   */
280  public long getRecommendedPollingInterval(final TimeUnit timeUnit) {
281    if (this == ON_DEMAND) {
282      throw new UnsupportedOperationException("ON_DEMAND mode does not support polling");
283    }
284
285    return timeUnit.convert(getRecommendedPollingInterval());
286  }
287
288  /**
289   * Returns a string representation of this mode.
290   *
291   * @return the display name of this mode
292   */
293  @Override
294  public String toString() {
295    return displayName;
296  }
297}
